result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Tario was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

- No Contact with firearms. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

-- Batterers Intervention program, or a course in Anger Management based on evaluation.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
- No Contact with Linda T.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
- Obtain/maintain employment or provide verification of disability benefits.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel Tario in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Linda T. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26210702 in court 1x on 6/17/15.

Defendant Daniel Tario in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case RECALLED. ADA was able to locate the victim in this matter. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 45 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 DAYS time served, with Huber.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 20 DAYS as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management based on evaluation.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with Linda T.
-Obtain/maintain employment or provide verification of disability benefits.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel Tario in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case Recalled. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case passed to attempt to locate the victim in this matter.

Defendant Daniel Tario in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Jury Trial. 1st call, parties ready to proceed to trial. Case passed to address calendar.
Receive and Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Missed Office Contact.

Defendant Daniel Tario in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Court ordered all motions filed and discovery turned over 20 DAYS prior to trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Jury Trial to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Daniel Tario in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests Scheduling Conference to allow further negotiations between the State and Defense. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel Tario
Current: 3053 N SHERMAN BLVD APT 10, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 01-22-2015)
Prior: 2741 North 48th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LINDA T.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Daniel Tario in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Daniel Tario in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
